moduleMetadataJson.name: Cloud Lookup (and Bypass)
moduleMetadataJson.description:
This module can be useful if you need to test the security of your server and your
          website behind a solution Cloud based. By discovering the origin IP address of the
          targeted host.

          More precisely, this module uses multiple data sources (in order ViewDNS.info, DNS enumeration
          and Censys) to collect assigned (or have been assigned) IP addresses from the targeted site or domain
          that uses the following:
            * Amazon Cloudflare, Amazon CloudFront, ArvanCloud, Envoy Proxy, Fastly, Stackpath Fireblade,
              Stackpath MaxCDN, Imperva Incapsula, InGen Security (BinarySec EasyWAF), KeyCDN, Microsoft AzureCDN,
              Netlify and Sucuri.
author: mekhalleh (RAMELLA SÃ©bastien)

options.name: WORKSPACE
options.description: Specify the workspace for this module

options.name: VERBOSE
options.description: Enable detailed status messages

options.name: RPORT
options.description: The target TCP port on which the protected website responds

options.name: CPORT
options.description: The local client port

options.name: CHOST
options.description: The local client address

options.name: SSL
options.description: Negotiate SSL/TLS for outgoing connections

options.name: SSLVersion
options.description: Specify the version of SSL/TLS to be used (Auto, TLS and SSL23 are auto-negotiate) (Accepted: Auto, TLS, SSL23, SSL3, TLS1, TLS1.1, TLS1.2)

options.name: SSLVerifyMode
options.description: SSL verification method (Accepted: CLIENT_ONCE, FAIL_IF_NO_PEER_CERT, NONE, PEER)

options.name: SSLCipher
options.description: String for SSL cipher - "DHE-RSA-AES256-SHA" or "ADH"

options.name: Proxies
options.description: A proxy chain of format type:host:port[,type:host:port][...]

options.name: ConnectTimeout
options.description: Maximum number of seconds to establish a TCP connection

options.name: TCP::max_send_size
options.description: Maxiumum tcp segment size.  (0 = disable)

options.name: TCP::send_delay
options.description: Delays inserted before every send.  (0 = disable)

options.name: DOMAIN
options.description: The target domain name

options.name: NS
options.description: Specify the nameservers to use for queries, space separated

options.name: SEARCHLIST
options.description: DNS domain search list, comma separated

options.name: THREADS
options.description: Threads for DNS enumeration

options.name: DnsClientDefaultNS
options.description: Specify the default to use for queries, space separated

options.name: DnsClientRetry
options.description: Number of times to try to resolve a record if no response is received

options.name: DnsClientRetryInterval
options.description: Number of seconds to wait before doing a retry

options.name: DnsClientReportARecords
options.description: Add hosts found via BRT and RVL to DB

options.name: DnsClientRVLExistingOnly
options.description: Only perform lookups on hosts in DB

options.name: DnsClientTcpDns
options.description: Run queries over TCP

options.name: DnsClientResolvconf
options.description: Resolvconf formatted configuration file to use for Resolver

options.name: DnsNote
options.description: Save all DNS results as notes

options.name: DnsClientUdpTimeout
options.description: Number of seconds to wait for a response to a UDP query

options.name: CENSYS_SECRET
options.description: The Censys API SECRET

options.name: CENSYS_UID
options.description: The Censys API UID

options.name: COMPSTR
options.description: You can use a custom string to perform the comparison (read documentation)

options.name: HOSTNAME
options.description: The hostname or domain name where we want to find the real IP address

options.name: IPBLACKLIST_FILE
options.description: Files containing IP addresses to blacklist during the analysis process, one per line

options.name: URIPATH
options.description: The URI path on which to perform the page comparison

options.name: WORDLIST
options.description: Wordlist of subdomains

options.name: ALLOW_NOWAF
options.description: Automatically switch to NoWAFBypass when detection fails with the Automatic action

options.name: ENUM_BRT
options.description: Set DNS bruteforce as optional

options.name: REPORT_LEAKS
options.description: Set to write leaked ip addresses in notes

options.name: USERAGENT
options.default: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; WOW64; rv:56.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/56.0
options.description: Specify a personalized User-Agent header in HTTP requests

options.name: TAG
options.description: Specify the HTML tag in which you want to find the fingerprint (Accepted: title, html)

options.name: HTTP_TIMEOUT
options.description: HTTP(s) request timeout
